title: Lix Schema Definition
description: A JSON schema document that defines Lix schema documents, including custom x-lix-* metadata for identification and versioning.

additionalProperties.description: Objects describing Lix schemas must not allow arbitrary additional properties; set this explicitly to false.

items.description: JSON Pointer referencing a property that participates in the primary key.
JSON Pointer referencing the local field.

properties.description: Local JSON-schema property names that participate in the FK

schemaKey.description: The x-lix-key of the referenced schema

items.description: JSON Pointer referencing the remote field.

properties.description: Remote property names (same length as local properties)

mode.description: Validation mode: immediate (default) or materialized (defer insert/update existence checks)

scope.description: Implicit columns (version_id and/or file_id) used to scope the foreign key relationship

x-lix-key.description: The schema identifier. Must be snake_case (lowercase, underscores) to safely embed in SQL identifiers.

x-lix-immutable.description: When true, entities for this schema cannot be updated after creation.

x-lix-override-lixcols.description: Default metadata column values (such as lixcol_file_id). Does not affect JSON property defaults.

x-lix-entity-views.description: Restricts which SQL entity views (lix_state/lix_state_by_version/lix_state_history) are generated. When omitted, all views are created.

x-lix-version.description: Schema version identifier. Deliberately constrained to a monotonic integer (as a string) without leading zeros to keep translation rules open while avoiding future breaking changes.

x-lix-default.description: CEL expression evaluated to produce the default value when the property is omitted.
